titleStmt.title: Palmerin D'Oliua The mirrour of nobilitie, mappe of honor, anotamie [sic] of rare fortunes, heroycall president of Loue: VVonder for chiualrie, and most accomplished knight in all perfections. Presenting to noble mindes, theyr courtlie desire, to gentles, theyr choise expectations, and to the inferior sorte, bowe to imitate theyr vertues: handled vvith modestie to shun offense, yet all delightfull, for recreation. Written in the Spanish, Italian and French; and from them turned into English by A.M., one of the messengers of her Maiesties chamber.
Palmerín de Oliva. Part 1. English.

Palmerin D'Oliua The mirrour of nobilitie, mappe of honor, anotamie [sic] of rare fortunes, heroycall president of Loue: VVonder for chiualrie, and most accomplished knight in all perfections. Presenting to noble mindes, theyr courtlie desire, to gentles, theyr choise expectations, and to the inferior sorte, bowe to imitate theyr vertues: handled vvith modestie to shun offense, yet all delightfull, for recreation. Written in the Spanish, Italian and French; and from them turned into English by A.M., one of the messengers of her Maiesties chamber.
Palmerín de Oliva. Part 1. English.
titleStmt.author: Munday, Anthony, 1553-1633. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I. Charlewood, for William VVright, and are to bee solde at his shop adioyning to S. Mildreds Church in the Poultrie, the middle shoppe in the rowe,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The famous historie of Palmerin D'Oliua.
Print show-through; pages stained, affecting some print.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
